properties.description: Placeholder for a list of items configured to launch at boot through launchd. This will be populated automatically

properties.description: Placeholder for a list of files in the logged in user's home folder. This will be populated automatically

properties.description: Placeholder for a list of mounted volumnes. This will be populated automatically

properties.description: Placeholder for a list of services allowed through the application layer firewall. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: SecureX Region
properties.description: Placeholder for the region being used. This is used when building links to Orbital and will be populated automatically

properties.name: Browser Extensions

properties.name: observable_type
properties.description: The type of observable pivoted on

properties.name: observable_value
properties.description: The value of the observable pivoted on. This should be a hostname for this workflow

properties.name: MAC Address
properties.description: Placeholder for the endpoint's MAC address. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Logged in User Details
properties.description: Placeholder for a list of details about the logged in user. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Hostname
properties.description: Placeholder for the endpoint's hostname. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: Network Connections
properties.description: Placeholder for a list of listening network connections. This will be populated automatically

properties.name: ServiceNow User ID
properties.description: The username of the user you're using to open incident tickets. This can either match the username in your ServiceNow account key or, if the account has the appropriate permissions, can be a different user

Runs multiple Oribtal queries on the endpoint provided to look for top incident response indicators of compromise. The results are then posted to a ServiceNow incident. Supported observables: hostname, mac_address, ip, amp_computer_guid

Target Group: Default TargetGroup

Targets: Orbital_For_Access_Token, Orbital_Target, ServiceNow

Steps:
[] Make sure the observable type provided is supported
[] Detect the region
[] Run Orbital queries for:
[]> Operating system information
[]> Logged in user details
[]> Recent logins
[]> Downloaded files
[]> Home directory files
[]> Hosts in host file
[]> Mounted volumes
[]> High memory processes
[]> Non-system processes
[]> Installed programs
[]> Browser extensions
[]> Network connections
[]> Open files for logged in user
[]> Launchd items
[]> Cronjobs
[]> Services in application layer firewall
[]> Homebrew packages
[]> Kernel extensions
[] Log results in a ServiceNow incident

More information: https://ciscosecurity.github.io/sxo-05-security-workflows/workflows/0058
